Uses of Package
vampire.editor.plugin.api.domain.sheet

  • Classes in vampire.editor.plugin.api.domain.sheet used by vampire.editor.plugin.api.domain.sheet 
    Class and Description
    BloodPoolAPI
    The BloodPool has a current value and a maximum value.
    CategoryAPI
    The CategoryAPI is an interface specializing the DataAPI interface.
    DamageType
    This enumeration provides the three types of damages:
    bashing damage, lethal damage and aggravated damage

    It is needed in HealthEntryAPI.
    DataAPI
    The "mother" interface of many interfaces in this package.
    HealthAPI
    The HealthAPI is an interface specializing the DataAPI interface.
    HealthEntryAPI
    HealthEntry stores the penalty of the dice pool, the name of the wounded level and the current damage type.
    MeritAPI
    Merit stores the cost and the name of a merit.
    MeritsAPI
    The MeritsAPI is an interface specializing the DataAPI interface.
    MetaAPI
    The MetaAPI is an interface specializing the DataAPI interface.
    MetaEntryAPI
    A meta entry is a pair of Strings, respectively a key and a value.
    Examples for meta entries are name, generation, haven and demeanor with their corresponding values.
    ModelToViewModelMapperAPI
    This interface maps all model objects to the according ViewAttributes object.
    Nameable
    This is the interface implemented by nearly all model objects.
    It provides a public clone method and a getter for the name.
    Implementation Note:
    Due to internationalization reasons, the name of a model object is a non-trivial issue.
    The convention is as follows:
    The name saved in the model is English, written with small letters and spaces substituted with underscores "_".
    For the output of this model, see the internationalization of the vampire editor.
    It needs to be secured, that only the convention stated above is stored in the model.
    PseudoDataAPI
    The pseudo "mother" interface of many interfaces in this package.
    SheetAPI
    This interface is the root of the model without view attributes.
    SubCategoryAPI
    The SubCategoryAPI is an interface specializing the DataAPI interface.
    TraitAPI
    A trait is a object containing the name of a trait and its Value Object.
    ValueAPI
    The ValueAPI offers the methods to get the properties of a value object:
    value: The value of the trait as an integer. maxValue: The maximal integer value can be.
